channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Is Trump taking too much aspirin? Here's what experts say
item.description: Trump takes four times the recommended dose of aspirin for cardiac prevention. Even low-dose aspirin is no longer recommended for people over 60 who don't have heart disease.
item.content:encoded:
Trump takes four times the recommended dose of aspirin for cardiac prevention. Even low-dose aspirin is no longer recommended for people over 60 who don't have heart disease.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Michal Ruprecht

item.title: Yemen's separatists announce a constitution for an independent south
item.description: The move comes as an escalation of a confrontation that has pitted Gulf powerhouses Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates against each other.
item.content:encoded:
The move comes as an escalation of a confrontation that has pitted Gulf powerhouses Saudi Arabia and the United Arab Emirates against each other.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: DHS pauses immigration applications for an additional 20 countries
item.description: The Department of Homeland Security is pausing immigration applications from 20 additional countries following increased scrutiny on people who seek legal pathways for immigrating to the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
The Department of Homeland Security is pausing immigration applications from 20 additional countries following increased scrutiny on people who seek legal pathways for immigrating to the U.S.

(Image credit: John Moore)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: George Clooney gets French citizenship — and another dust-up with Trump
item.description: The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.
item.content:encoded:
The French government says it granted George and Amal Clooney citizenship because of their contributions to its international influence. Their family has primarily lived in France since 2021.

(Image credit: Henry Nicholls)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Trump vows to 'rescue' Iran's protesters. Iran warns the U.S. to stay out of it
item.description: President Trump warned Iran not to kill protesters. Iranian officials alleged the U.S. and Israel were stoking the sweeping protests, and said U.S. military bases in the region are legitimate targets.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump warned Iran not to kill protesters. Iranian officials alleged the U.S. and Israel were stoking the sweeping protests, and said U.S. military bases in the region are legitimate targets.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon, Bilal Hussein)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Somali day care centers face threats. And, how Trump could save Obamacare subsidies
item.description: Somali-run daycare centers in Minnesota report receiving threats following a viral video that accused them of fraud. And, how Trump could play a role in extending ACA subsidies.
item.content:encoded:
Somali-run daycare centers in Minnesota report receiving threats following a viral video that accused them of fraud. And, how Trump could play a role in extending ACA subsidies.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Slow Epstein files release not as concerning as docs DOJ has withheld, says Ro Khanna
item.description: Rep. Ro Khanna of California says the Justice Department should've started preparing Epstein files for release months ago. Now, he tells NPR how Congress could intervene to speed up the process.
item.content:encoded:
Rep. Ro Khanna of California says the Justice Department should've started preparing Epstein files for release months ago. Now, he tells NPR how Congress could intervene to speed up the process.

(Image credit: J. Scott Applewhite)
item.dc:creator: Michel Martin

item.title: Brain organoids are helping researchers, but their use also creates unease
item.description: Pea-size clusters of human cells called brain organoids inspire both hope and fear. Experts are debating how scientists can responsibly use these bits of gray matter.
item.content:encoded:
Pea-size clusters of human cells called brain organoids inspire both hope and fear. Experts are debating how scientists can responsibly use these bits of gray matter.

(Image credit: Institut Pasteur-SupBiotech/NASA)
item.dc:creator: Jon Hamilton

item.title: U.S. interventions in Latin America and the Caribbean haven't always gone as planned
item.description: President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's pressure campaign against Venezuela is the latest in a long saga of U.S. intervention in the region that is rooted in the 1823 Monroe Doctrine — and is a mix of success and failure.

(Image credit: Miguel Vinas)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: With few Epstein files released, conspiracy theories flourish and questions remain
item.description: President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted the questions. Here's what we know — and don't.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's changing messaging, Congress' unprecedented demands and the Justice Department's piecemeal release of information haven't quieted the questions. Here's what we know — and don't.

(Image credit: Staff)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
